Database

Class UserPlayerDatabaseController

  • java.lang.Object
    • Database.UserPlayerDatabaseController

  • public class UserPlayerDatabaseController
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is a wrapper for the SQL queries to the database for the User and Player objects. It also provides the additional logic functionality needed. For example it ensures that unique login information has been provided before saving new user registration to the database. It also creates objects of these classes and save the new object information to the database. A new Player is created for a User when a new game is started.

      • doesUserLoginExist

        public boolean doesUserLoginExist(java.lang.String username,
                                  java.lang.String password)
        Looks for a match to the login information in the database by testing for a match to the combination of the username and password
        Parameters:
        username - login
        password - login
        Returns:
        boolean if match found returns true, if not returns false

      • registerNewUser

        public boolean registerNewUser(java.lang.String firstname,
                               java.lang.String lastname,
                               java.lang.String username,
                               java.lang.String password)
        Saves the new user registration information to the database so it can be used in logins later. The database then assigns the user a user id. If the combination of login username and password are already in the database the registration will not succeed, the value of false is returned, and the new user is not saved to the database. if successful returns true if cannot save user returns false
        Parameters:
        firstname - real name
        lastname - real name
        username - for login
        password - for login
        Returns:
        boolean

      • getUserByLogin

        public User getUserByLogin(java.lang.String username,
                           java.lang.String password)
        Gets the user from the database that corresponds to that users unique login information as username and password. If successful returns a new User object with the data values belonging to the user, else returns a NULL User object.
        Parameters:
        username - login
        password - login
        Returns:
        User the new User object

      • getUserByID

        public User getUserByID(int id)
        Gets the User from the database that corresponds to that User's unique id key. If successful returns a new User object with the data values belonging to the user, else returns a NULL User object.
        Parameters:
        id - the user id
        Returns:
        User

      • updateUserLogin

        public boolean updateUserLogin(int userID,
                               java.lang.String newUsername,
                               java.lang.String newPassword)
        Saves the User's new login information to the database so it can be used in logins later. If the new User login information is not unique or the user id is not in the database, then the save will fail and return false.
        Parameters:
        userID - the user id in the database
        newUsername - new login
        newPassword - new login
        Returns:
        boolean if successful returns true, else returns false

      • addNewPlayer

        public Player addNewPlayer(User user,
                           int token_id,
                           int game_id)
        Saves the new player information to the database so it be used in a game. The database then assigns the new player an id, token, space 1, and active status. If successful returns a new Player object and gives the User the, else returns a NULL Player object.
        Parameters:
        user - the user id
        token_id - the token id
        game_id - the game id in the database
        Returns:
        Player

      • getPlayerByID

        Parameters:
        id - the player id in the database
        Returns:
        Player

        Returns:
